Effective communication and advocacy is essential to the success of LECReD and every partner of LECReD must be a communication agent. CSES provided guidance on how to deliver key LECReD messages and how to elevate visibility for the messages. CSES also provided the tools to help educate, advocate, prompt dialogue and build partnerships around the LECReD messages. The CSES took stock of the successful lessons and limiting factors that have shaped community based projects in the Maldives in the past. The development of the CSES was preceded by a stakeholder survey in Laamu Atoll, assuming that L

title.narrative: GCF-Managing climate change induced water shortages

description.narrative: This project aims to deliver safe and secure freshwater to 105,000 people in the islands of Maldives in the face of climate change risks

description.narrative: Enabling 49 targeted islands (across 13 atolls) to put in place an integrated water supply system
capital of a political entity

activity-description.narrative: Project is conducted across 49 islands in the Maldives

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

1A: # of hh on target 49 islands receive a year-round safe and affordable freshwater supply (disaggregated by gender) 2A: # of people receiving dry season water 3 days ahead of need from decentralized, atoll-based water production and distribution hubs. 2B: % of expected reduction in dry season water supply cost 3A: % increase in Groundwater recharge rate 3B: % of use of groundwater as freshwater (Groundwater quality improvements against EPA standards)

comment.narrative: 1A: Target island population do not have a reliable and functional water production and supply system, qualifying for annual water emergency supply. 2A: - 2B: A total annual cost of emergency operation ranges between US$300,000-500,000, depending on number of islands serviced as well as a distance from the central supplier - Male‚Äô. 3A: Groundwater quality does not meet freshwater quality requirements and only used for secondary or tertiary use and current recharge rates in target islands are 0%. 3B: EPA standards for groundwater quality are not met.
1A: 0 2A: 0 2B: 0% 3A: 0% 3B: 0% Note: Project document signed, funds transferred and implementation commenced by Q4 of 2017. Targets to be set from 2018 onwards.
